recipes.title: Lebkuchengewürz (German Gingerbread Spice)
recipes.author: Kimberly Killebrew
recipes.notes: Essential ingredient for authentic tasting Lebkuchen, Pfeffernüsee, and more.

directions.direction: Combine the spices together and store in an airtight jar in a cool, dark place for up to one year.
For superior flavor, grind spices from toasted and freshly ground whole spices. Heat a dry skillet over medium heat and toast the spices until very fragrant but not scorched.

recipes.title: Nürnberger Elisenlebkuchen (German Lebkuchen)
recipes.author: Kimberly Killebrew
recipes.notes: A popular and beloved German Christmas confection.

directions.direction: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.
Toss the candied lemon and orange peel with about 1/4 cup all-purpose flour to prevent sticking, then pulse in a food processor until finely minced. Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs until foamy. Add the sugar, honey, and vanilla extract, beating until combined.
Add the ground almonds, hazelnuts, salt, baking powder, Lebkuchengewürz, and the minced candied peels. Stir vigorously until thoroughly combined.
Scoop the mixture onto Backoblaten, smoothing the top. Set them on a lined cookie sheet.
Bake on the middle rack of the oven for 25-28 minutes. Allow to cool completely after removing.
For glazing, dip half of the Lebkuchen in chocolate glaze and half in sugar glaze, letting excess drip off. Place on a wire rack to dry.
Store in an airtight container. Will keep for several weeks; flavor improves with time.

recipes.title: Strawberry Poke Cake
recipes.author: Betty Crocker Kitchens
recipes.notes: A tender-crumbed white cake filled with strawberry Jell-O, topped with fluffy frosting and fresh strawberries.

directions.direction: Heat oven to 350°F (325°F for dark or nonstick pan). Make and bake cake as directed on box for 13x9-inch pan, using water, oil, and egg whites. Cool in pan on cooling rack for 20 minutes.

In a medium bowl, pour boiling water on gelatin; stir until gelatin is dissolved. Poke cake every inch with the handle of a wooden spoon or tines of a fork halfway into the cake. Carefully pour strawberry gelatin evenly over the top of the cake. Cool completely, about 1 hour.
Spoon and spread frosting over top of cake. Cut into 4 rows by 3 rows. Garnish each piece of cake with strawberries. Store loosely covered in the refrigerator.

ingredients.ingredient: Betty Crocker™ Super Moist™ White Cake Mix

ingredients.quantity: As called for on cake mix box
ingredients.ingredient: Water, vegetable oil, and egg whites
Betty Crocker™ Whipped Fluffy White Frosting
